thread.title: Obama to White House heckler: 'You're in my house!'
thread.title_full: Obama to White House heckler: 'You're in my house!'

title: Obama to White House heckler: 'You're in my house!'
text:
CNN.com
Obama shuts down White House heckler: 'You're in my house!' By Kevin Liptak , CNN White House Producer Updated 2258 GMT (0558 HKT) June 24, 2015 U.S. President Barack Obama speaks about the US government's hostage policy review in the Roosevelt Room of the White House in Washington, D.C., June 24, 2015. Washington (CNN) President Barack Obama is used to hecklers stopping him during speeches -- but he draws the line when the audience interrupts him in his own house. As Obama was speaking at a White House event honoring LGBT Pride Month on Wednesday, an accented voice rang out from the crowd. Obama wasn't amused. JUST WATCHED
